bug.author: davechallis
bug.description:
I've previously (in other lemmatization software) seen "inner" -> "inner" (but again, not sure what correct lemma is, only that "inn" seems wrong here). I did notice some tasks for improving lemmatization in Spacy in future though, so can hold off on reporting lemmatization issues if it's not helpful at the moment. Example case: <denchmark-code>import spacy nlp = spacy.load('en') for token in nlp("Wearing inners in the innermost inner space in the inn."): print(token, token.lemma_) </denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>Wearing wear inners inner in in the the innermost innermost inner inn space space in in the the inn inn . . </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 1.7.2 Platform: Darwin-16.4.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.0 Installed models: en

comments.comment: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
